revised_title: Investigating the Flexor Reflex After-Discharge and Antidromic Volleys
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the flexor reflex after-discharge and found that an antidromic volley can cause a period of quiescence in the after-discharge. They concluded that this period of quiescence is related to the removal of central excitatory state (c.e.s.) and the interval between successive discharges of a motoneuron.
